activeRevisionsMode.description:
ActiveRevisionsMode controls how active revisions are handled for the Container app:
<list><item>Multiple: multiple revisions can be active.</item><item>Single: Only one revision can be active at a time. Revision weights can not be used in this mode. If no value if provided, this is the default.</item></list>.

maxInactiveRevisions.description: Optional. Max inactive revisions a Container App can have.

registries.description: Collection of private container registry credentials for containers used by the Container app

secrets.description: Collection of secrets used by a Container app

repositories.description: Repositories of Application Configuration Service git property.

password.description: Password of git repository basic auth.

patterns.description: Collection of patterns of the repository

privateKey.description: Private sshKey algorithm of git repository.

strictHostKeyChecking.description: Strict host key checking or not.

username.description: Username of git repository basic auth.

resourceRequests.description: Resource request payload of Application Configuration Service

settings.description: The settings of Application Configuration Service.

ConfigurationServiceSettings.description: The settings of Application Configuration Service.

name.description: Custom container name.

probes.description: List of probes for the container.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 10.

httpGet.description: HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness probes are initiated. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 60.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 240.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 10.

tcpSocket.description: TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod's terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is an alpha field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Maximum value is 3600 seconds (1 hour)

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 240.

ContainerAppProbe.description: Probe describes a health check to be performed against a container to determine whether it is alive or ready to receive traffic.

host.description: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP. You probably want to set "Host" in httpHeaders instead.

httpHeaders.description: Custom headers to set in the request. HTTP allows repeated headers.

path.description: Path to access on the HTTP server.

port.description: Name or number of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

scheme.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Defaults to HTTP.

ContainerAppProbeHttpGet.description: HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.

name.description: The header field name

ContainerAppProbeHttpGetHttpHeadersItem.description: HTTPHeader describes a custom header to be used in HTTP probes

host.description: Optional: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.

port.description: Number or name of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

ContainerAppProbeTcpSocket.description: TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported.

configuration.description: Non versioned Container App configuration properties that define the mutable settings of a Container app

managedEnvironmentId.description: Deprecated. Resource ID of the Container App's environment.

template.description:
Container App versioned application definition.
Defines the desired state of an immutable revision.
Any changes to this section Will result in a new revision being created

workloadProfileName.description: Workload profile name for container apps to execute on.

disableProbe.description: Indicates whether disable the liveness and readiness probe

allowCredentials.description: Specifies whether the resource allows credentials

allowedMethods.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-methods header

allowedOrigins.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-origins header

exposeHeaders.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-expose-headers header

maxAge.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-max-age header

args.description: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided.

command.description: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided.

containerImage.description: Container image of the custom container. This should be in the form of <repository>:<tag> without the server name of the registry

languageFramework.description: Language framework of the container image uploaded

server.description: The name of the registry that contains the container image

certificateId.description: Resource Id of the Certificate to be bound to this hostname. Must exist in the Managed Environment.

name.description: Hostname.

CustomDomain.description: Custom Domain of a Container App

certName.description: The bound certificate name of domain.

CustomDomainProperties.description: Custom domain of app resource payload.

auth.description: Authentication secrets for the custom scale rule.

metadata.description: Metadata properties to describe custom scale rule.

Type of the custom scale rule
eg: azure-servicebus, redis etc.

CustomScaleRule.description: Azure Spring Apps App Instance Custom scaling rule.

appPort.description: Tells Dapr which port your application is listening on

appProtocol.description: Tells Dapr which protocol your application is using. Valid options are http and grpc. Default is http.

enableApiLogging.description: Enables API logging for the Dapr sidecar

enabled.description: Boolean indicating if the Dapr side car is enabled

httpMaxRequestSize.description: Increasing max size of request body http and grpc servers parameter in MB to handle uploading of big files. Default is 4 MB.

httpReadBufferSize.description: Dapr max size of http header read buffer in KB to handle when sending multi-KB headers. Default is 65KB.

logLevel.description: Sets the log level for the Dapr sidecar. Allowed values are debug, info, warn, error. Default is info.

active.description: Indicates whether the Deployment is active

containerProbeSettings.description: Container liveness and readiness probe settings

livenessProbe.description: Probe describes a health check to be performed against an App Instance to determine whether it is alive or ready to receive traffic.

readinessProbe.description: Probe describes a health check to be performed against an App Instance to determine whether it is alive or ready to receive traffic.

startupProbe.description: Probe describes a health check to be performed against an App Instance to determine whether it is alive or ready to receive traffic.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Optional duration in seconds the App Instance needs to terminate gracefully. May be decreased in delete request. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the App Instance are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. Defaults to 90 seconds.

DevToolPortalFeatureDetail.description: Detail settings for Dev Tool Portal feature

applicationAccelerator.description: Detail settings for Dev Tool Portal feature

metadataUrl.description: The URI of a JSON file with generic OIDC provider configuration.

scopes.description: It defines the specific actions applications can be allowed to do on a user's behalf

name.description: Environment variable name.

secretRef.description: Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the environment variable value.

Error.description: The error code compose of code and message.

command.description: Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command is root ('/') in the container's filesystem. The command is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions ('|', etc) won't work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.

ExecAction.description: ExecAction describes a "run in container" action.

description.description: Detailed description of the APIs available on the Gateway instance (default: `Generated OpenAPI 3 document that describes the API routes configured.`)

documentation.description: Location of additional documentation for the APIs available on the Gateway instance

serverUrl.description: Base URL that API consumers will use to access APIs on the Gateway instance.

title.description: Title describing the context of the APIs available on the Gateway instance (default: `Spring Cloud Gateway for K8S`)

version.description: Version of APIs available on this Gateway instance (default: `unspecified`).

GatewayApiMetadataProperties.description: API metadata property for Spring Cloud Gateway

description.description: A description, will be applied to methods in the generated OpenAPI documentation.

filters.description: To modify the request before sending it to the target endpoint, or the received response.

predicates.description: A number of conditions to evaluate a route for each request. Each predicate may be evaluated against request headers and parameter values. All of the predicates associated with a route must evaluate to true for the route to be matched to the request.

tags.description: Classification tags, will be applied to methods in the generated OpenAPI documentation.

title.description: A title, will be applied to methods in the generated OpenAPI documentation.

tokenRelay.description: Pass currently-authenticated user's identity token to application service, default is 'false'

GatewayApiRoute.description: API route config of the Spring Cloud Gateway

allowCredentials.description: Whether user credentials are supported on cross-site requests. Valid values: `true`, `false`.

allowedHeaders.description: Allowed headers in cross-site requests. The special value `*` allows actual requests to send any header.

allowedMethods.description: Allowed HTTP methods on cross-site requests. The special value `*` allows all methods. If not set, `GET` and `HEAD` are allowed by default.

allowedOrigins.description: Allowed origins to make cross-site requests. The special value `*` allows all domains.

exposedHeaders.description: HTTP response headers to expose for cross-site requests.

maxAge.description: How long, in seconds, the response from a pre-flight request can be cached by clients.

certificates.description: Collection of certificate resource Ids in Azure Spring Apps.

certificateVerification.description: Whether to enable certificate verification or not.

memory.description: Memory allocated to each Spring Cloud Gateway instance.

appResourceId.description: The resource Id of the Azure Spring Apps app, required unless route defines `uri`.

filters.description: To modify the request before sending it to the target endpoint, or the received response in app level.

openApi.description: OpenAPI properties of Spring Cloud Gateway route config.

predicates.description: A number of conditions to evaluate a route for each request in app level. Each predicate may be evaluated against request headers and parameter values. All of the predicates associated with a route must evaluate to true for the route to be matched to the request.

protocol.description: Protocol of routed Azure Spring Apps applications.

routes.description: Array of API routes, each route contains properties such as `title`, `uri`, `ssoEnabled`, `predicates`, `filters`.

ssoEnabled.description: Enable Single Sign-On in app level.

GatewayRouteConfigProperties.description: API route config of the Spring Cloud Gateway

clientCertificateMode.description: Client certificate mode for mTLS authentication. Ignore indicates server drops client certificate on forwarding. Accept indicates server forwards client certificate but does not require a client certificate. Require indicates server requires a client certificate.

disableProbe.description: Indicate whether the probe is disabled.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Minimum value is 1.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the App Instance has started before probes are initiated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Minimum value is 1.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1.

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Minimum value is 1.

containers.description: List of container definitions for the Container App.

revisionSuffix.description: User friendly suffix that is appended to the revision name

volumes.description: List of volume definitions for the Container App.

Template.description:
Container App versioned application definition.
Defines the desired state of an immutable revision.
Any changes to this section Will result in a new revision being created

label.description: Associates a traffic label with a revision

latestRevision.description: Indicates that the traffic weight belongs to a latest stable revision

weight.description: Traffic weight assigned to a revision

TrafficWeight.description: Traffic weight assigned to a revision

id.description: The unique build id of this build result

relativePath.description: Relative path of the storage which stores the source

name.description: Volume name.

secrets.description: List of secrets to be added in volume. If no secrets are provided, all secrets in collection will be added to volume.

storageName.description: Name of storage resource. No need to provide for EmptyDir and Secret.

storageType.description: Storage type for the volume. If not provided, use EmptyDir.

Volume.description: Volume definitions for the Container App.

mountPath.description: Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.Must not contain ':'.

volumeName.description: This must match the Name of a Volume.
